listitem.para:
List< string > contentsDirList
<summary> Main Lists for filenames. Dir , File, Ext </summary>

List< string > FilesReadOnlytoFix
<summary> Pass a resetList of files that had the read-only attribute fixed, so Form2 can display it </summary>

List< NameDateObj > FilestoConfirmList
<summary> List of Class to be passed to Form 2 for confirmation of files</summary>
ListView listViewContents
ImageList imageListFiles
SkippedHSR Skips
Random random
string CwdPathName
BoolCMA checkboxes
guistatus gui
List< string > contentsFileList
List< string > filextlist

DataModel ( )
<summary> Constructor </summary>

void Clear ( bool resetList)
<summary> Clear contents Dir + File lists </summary>
List< string > PopulateFileList ( string path)
List< string > PopulateDirList ( string path)

void DisplayContentsList ( bool checkboxRecurse, string labelname, bool filesonly)
<summary> Display subfiles and subdirectories in the right panel listview </summary>

DateTime DecideWhichTimeMode1 ( string path)
<summary> Returns a DateTime after examining the radiobuttons/checkboxes to specify the logic behavior. </summary>

DateTime DecideTimeFromSubDirFile ( string path)
<summary> Check all the subdirs or subfiles. And decide the time. Called from above: DecideWhichTimeMode1() { radioGroupBox3_UseTimeFrom </summary>

void RecurseSubDirectoryMode1 ( string directoryPath, bool checkedRecurse, bool checkedShouldFiles)
<summary> Mode 1: Process One directory, with recursive sub-directory support. Calls SetFileDateTime() (Only adds to the confirm list, Form 2 will actually write changes). </summary>

void RecurseSubDirectoryMode2 ( string directoryPath)
<summary> Mode 2: Recursive. </summary>

void RecurseSubDirectoryMode1Parent ( string directoryPath, bool checkedRecurse, bool checkedShouldFiles)
<summary> Mode 1P (start at its Parent) </summary>

void RecurseSubDirectoryMode2Parent ( string directoryPath)
<summary> Mode 2P (start at its Parent) </summary>

void SetTimeDateEachDirectory ( string directoryPath, DateTime fileDateTime, bool checkedRecurse, bool checkedShouldFiles)
<summary> Set Directory Time </summary>

void SetTimeDateEachFile ( string directoryPath, DateTime fileDateTime)
<summary> Set File Time </summary>

void SkipOrAddFile ( string path, bool isDirectory)
<summary> Tracks H,S,R skipcount. Print a Messagebox Question if trying to skip read only files, and fix RO files if needed </summary>

void SetFileDateTimeMode1 ( string filePath, DateTime fileTime, bool isDirectory)
<summary> STATIC. Set the date/time for a single file/directory (This works on files and directories) Go through the list, skipping H,S,R files, and add all the file+date objects to the Confirmation List (Only adds to the confirm list, Form 2 (Confirm) will actually write changes). </summary>

NameDateObj Makedateobject ( string filePath, DateTime fileTime, bool isDirectory)
<summary> Static. Overloaded. Make a NameDateObj out of 1 filename; writes A SINGLE time to all 3 date properties. </summary>

NameDateObj Makedateobject ( string folderPath, NameDateObj subObj)
<summary> Static. Overloaded. Make a NameDateObj out of 1 filename; writes each time time to the date attribute that was radiobutton selected. </summary>

DisplayCmaTimeData GetCmaTimes ( string pathName)
<summary> Display the date and time of the selected file (also works on Directories) </summary>

NameDateObj DecideWhichTimeMode2 ( string directoryPath)
<summary> Very long function that does a simple task. Read in the options the user set for the operation, and Decide on the timestamp it should use, by the end we will have a single object with 3 times. This will need to be hit with broad strokes if we attempt to do any more work on the program. </summary>

section.title: void genBTC.FileTime.Models.DataModel.DisplayContentsList (bool checkboxRecurse, string labelname, bool filesonly=true)
section.emphasis: <summary> Display subfiles and subdirectories in the right panel listview </summary>
section.para:
Parameters
filesonly
Don't show the directories, only files.
reqs: listviewcontents, contentsDirList,contentsFileList, labelFpathText, checkbox_recurse, filextlist, imageList_Files

section.title: DateTime genBTC.FileTime.Models.DataModel.DecideWhichTimeMode1 (string path)
section.emphasis: <summary> Returns a DateTime after examining the radiobuttons/checkboxes to specify the logic behavior. </summary>

section.emphasis: <summary> Check all the subdirs or subfiles. And decide the time. Called from above: DecideWhichTimeMode1() { radioGroupBox3_UseTimeFrom </summary>

section.title: void genBTC.FileTime.Models.DataModel.RecurseSubDirectoryMode1 (string directoryPath, bool checkedRecurse, bool checkedShouldFiles)
section.emphasis: <summary> Mode 1: Process One directory, with recursive sub-directory support. Calls SetFileDateTime() (Only adds to the confirm list, Form 2 will actually write changes). </summary>
section.para:
Parameters
directoryPath
Full path to the directory
req, checkBox_Recurse.Checked, checkBoxShouldFiles.Checked

void genBTC.FileTime.Models.DataModel.SkipOrAddFile (string path, bool isDirectory)
section.emphasis: <summary> Tracks H,S,R skipcount. Print a Messagebox Question if trying to skip read only files, and fix RO files if needed </summary>

section.title: void genBTC.FileTime.Models.DataModel.SetFileDateTimeMode1 (string filePath, DateTime fileTime, bool isDirectory)
section.emphasis: <summary> STATIC. Set the date/time for a single file/directory (This works on files and directories) Go through the list, skipping H,S,R files, and add all the file+date objects to the Confirmation List (Only adds to the confirm list, Form 2 (Confirm) will actually write changes). </summary>
section.para:
Requires: Pass in the datamodel and the checkbox states.
Parameters
filePath
Full path to the file/directory
fileTime
Date/Time to set the file/directory
isDirectory
Is this a directory???
